title: Sky customers can now get Netflix for free - here's how
text:

For everyone that's already paying once for their Sky subscription and a second time for Netflix ... a game-changing new offer has just gone live.

As you can now get your Sky and Netflix all in one place on Sky Q for just £25 a month - exactly the same price as a standard Sky Q subscription.

The new £25 monthly bundle deal means that the £8.99 you usually pay for your standard Netflix (HD) account is now completely free.

Having launched today (October 18) on the Sky website, after the discount event is over, the same combo-subscription will set you back £9 more, at £34 per month in total.

Available to all new and existing customers but only for a limited time, it includes Sky Entertainment and Netflix Standard (HD).

As well as combining your monthly payments, Netflix is also now fully integrated onto the Sky Q platform, so there’s no need to launch a separate app, and there's no need to re-sign up to Netflix, as you can just link up your existing account and profiles to your new Sky Q subscription.

Whilst you can still watch Netflix like usual on the app, unlike standard Netflix, you will need to sign up for a full 18-month subscription, and pay an initial £20 set up fee for your Sky Q box.

The deal is available to all new and existing members, and the limited-time offer includes access to Sky Entertainment with over 1,000 shows, including Sky Originals like Chernobyl, Brassic, Catherine the Great, and Temple, as well as epic Netflix Originals like Stranger Things, Top Boy and The Crown.

You'll also be able to watch over 500 box sets from Sky in HD, including the critically acclaimed Succession and Sharp Objects - just in time for the darker nights and cold winter.
description: You can now get Sky Q and Netflix for £25 a month altogether
